docs.abstract: Complete disengagement is impossible, but both Washington and Beijing envision a day when they don’t need each other as much to power their economies.
docs.snippet: Complete disengagement is impossible, but both Washington and Beijing envision a day when they don’t need each other as much to power their economies.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The economic relationship between China and the United States has defined the modern era. It helped lift hundreds of millions of people in China out of poverty. It gave affordable iPhones and other gadgets to American consumers, handed big profits to American companies and delivered 1.3 billion hungry customers to American farmers.

headline.main: On Trade, the U.S. and China Consider the Unthinkable: Breaking Up
headline.print_headline: Trade Giants See a Future With Few Ties

docs.abstract: Victory could be difficult to verify, much less achieve, as the U.S. protests Beijing’s effort to retool Chinese industries for the 21st century.
docs.snippet: Victory could be difficult to verify, much less achieve, as the U.S. protests Beijing’s effort to retool Chinese industries for the 21st century.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — At the heart of the intensifying trade dispute between the United States and China is a fundamental question: Which country is more willing to endure short-term pain for the long-term gain of playing a leading role in high-tech industries.

headline.main: U.S. and China Play Chicken on Trade, and Neither Swerves
headline.print_headline: China and U.S. Refuse to Blink As Threats Rise

docs.abstract: An economic upturn led to rising fossil-fuel emissions after two years of drops, showing the task Beijing faces in fulfilling its climate promises.
docs.snippet: An economic upturn led to rising fossil-fuel emissions after two years of drops, showing the task Beijing faces in fulfilling its climate promises.
docs.lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland — Xi Jinping, China’s president, galvanized supporters of the climate-change fight last year when he told an audience at the World Economic Forum that the effort “is a responsibility we must assume for future generations.”

headline.main: China’s Emissions: More Than U.S. Plus Europe, and Still Rising
headline.print_headline: Forum Lauds Climate Efforts by China Even as Its Emissions Climb

byline.original: By Keith Bradsher and Lisa Friedman

docs.abstract: A call to strike by unions representing Air France employees highlights the widening divide between workers and the French state as President Emmanuel Macron pushes business-friendly changes.
docs.snippet: A call to strike by unions representing Air France employees highlights the widening divide between workers and the French state as President Emmanuel Macron pushes business-friendly changes.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — In the first year of his presidency, Emmanuel Macron has pushed business-friendly labor laws through Parliament, made it easier for companies to hire and fire, cut the wealth tax and decentralized collective bargaining. Through it all, France’s most militant unions have resisted.

headline.main: Air France Dispute Threatens to Escalate Macron’s Battle With Labor
headline.print_headline: Widening Feud With Macron, Airline Unions Call for Strike

docs.abstract: Companies in Britain, recently forced to publish the differences in salaries between men and women, are trying a variety of ways to close the divide.
docs.snippet: Companies in Britain, recently forced to publish the differences in salaries between men and women, are trying a variety of ways to close the divide.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A law firm is giving female lawyers more flexible work schedules. A technology giant wants to increase the ranks of its female engineers. And a media company is recruiting greater numbers of women to mirror its client base more closely.

headline.main: The Gender Pay Gap: Trying to Narrow It
headline.print_headline: Taking On the Pay Gap, One Industry at a Time

byline.original: By Amie Tsang and Liz Alderman

docs.abstract: By forcing companies to publicly air salary discrepancies between men and women, Britain hopes to narrow the pay gap.
docs.snippet: By forcing companies to publicly air salary discrepancies between men and women, Britain hopes to narrow the pay gap.
docs.lead_paragraph: The gender pay gaps detailed by British companies in recent months surprised almost no one — men are paid more than women, often by a wide margin, at the vast majority of businesses.

headline.main: Britain Aims to Close Gender Pay Gap With Transparency and Shame
headline.print_headline: Britain Aims to Close Pay Gap With Transparency and Shame

docs.abstract: The Chinese Ministry of Commerce announced duties of up to 25 percent on American goods, including pork, retaliating against steel and aluminum tariffs.
docs.snippet: The Chinese Ministry of Commerce announced duties of up to 25 percent on American goods, including pork, retaliating against steel and aluminum tariffs.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The Chinese government hit back Monday at President Trump’s tariffs on steel and aluminum by acting on a threat to put tariffs as high as 25 percent on imports of 128 American-made products, including pork and seamless steel pipes.

headline.main: China Slaps Tariffs on 128 U.S. Products, Including Wine, Pork and Pipes
headline.print_headline: China Makes Good on Threat of Tariffs, Raising Its Duties on 128 U.S. Products

docs.abstract: Sharp moves in the stock market come as investors digest the growth prospects for the world and look for signs of inflation.
docs.snippet: Sharp moves in the stock market come as investors digest the growth prospects for the world and look for signs of inflation.
docs.lead_paragraph: Since the global financial crisis a decade ago, a few simple guidelines have helped investors make sense of the markets.

headline.main: Dow Jones and S.&P. Slide Again, Dropping by More Than 4%
headline.print_headline: Further Broad Declines Agitate Global Markets And Unnerve Investors

docs.abstract: Stock markets in the United States lost ground on Wednesday in a seesaw trading session after experiencing a big rebound the day before.
docs.snippet: Stock markets in the United States lost ground on Wednesday in a seesaw trading session after experiencing a big rebound the day before.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks fell Wednesday in a seesaw trading session, as markets sought direction after several tumultuous days of trading.

headline.main: Gains on Wall St. Subside as Global Investors Grow Cautious
headline.print_headline: Searching for Direction,  Market Zigzags Lower

byline.original: By Matt Phillips and Jack Ewing

docs.abstract: Argentina and now Turkey have been forced to raise interest rates to defend their currencies from growing pressure on emerging markets.
docs.snippet: Argentina and now Turkey have been forced to raise interest rates to defend their currencies from growing pressure on emerging markets.
docs.lead_paragraph: Add a familiar item to the list of worries for investors: turmoil in the emerging markets.

headline.main: Emerging Markets Are Worrying Investors, Again
headline.print_headline: Bet on Emerging Markets Gets Riskier as Lira and Peso Sink

byline.original: By Matt Phillips and Landon Thomas Jr
